> --- In junit@y..., Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@b...> wrote:
> >
> > > Would it make sense to add a corresponding
> assertFalse(someCondition) to
> > > JUnit?
> >
> > You will soon have demands for assertNotEquals, assertNotSame,
> assertGreaterThan, assertNotGreaterThan, assertLessThan,
> assertLesserThan, assertALittleBitLesserThan...
> >
>
> I agree that there's likely a bit of a slippery slope there.  I'm not
> sure where to draw the line.  It's just something I noticed while I
> was making the change in some of our code.
>
> Randy
> --
> Randy Coulman
> Senior Software Engineer
> Key Technology, Inc.
> RCoulman@...

Some people say that if it's not light, it's not right while other people
prefer richer semantics. Fortunately, it's easy enough to add your own
assertion methods and other utilities by extending junit.framework.Testcase
with your own root test case class and subclassing off of that.
